meanings.definition: To become or cause to become cheesy or like cheese.
meanings.sent1: After leaving the milk out for too long, it caseated and turned into a solid mass.
meanings.sent2: The pizza was left out overnight, causing the cheese to caseate and become hard.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally caseated the cheese by forgetting to put it back in the fridge.
meanings.sent4: The warm temperature in the room made the cheese caseate quickly, much like a science experiment.
meanings.sent5: The cheese caseated into a gooey mess, resembling melted plastic.

meanings.sent1: The chef sprinkled the caseated cheese on top of the pasta dish.
meanings.sent2: The deli offered a variety of caseated cheeses for sale.
meanings.sent3: The mouse nibbled on the caseated cheese, leaving tiny teeth marks.
meanings.sent4: The caseated substance had a strong aroma, reminiscent of aged cheddar.
meanings.sent5: The caseated cheese oozed out of the sandwich, tempting anyone nearby with its rich smell.
